result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J. Czerwionka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
++  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
++  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  May Not have contact with Travis V or Co -Defendants, known felons or drug dealers.

timeConds.notes: Huber is allowed. Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
** Pay fine of $300.00  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).  Perform 100 hours of community service work for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization  May Not have contact with Travcis V  unless otherwiser permitted by the court.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Sentencing on Ct 1 on 3/9/18 @ 9:30 a.m.  Deft may expunge record upon successful completion of probation and conditions.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of probation imposed by the Judge

State appears by special prosecutor, Atty. Lara Parker.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Terry Rose.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  State is in compliance with victim notification.  Sentencing arguments heard.  The court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 2 years w/conditions.  The court imposes 5 months KCJ as a condition of probation; Huber is allowed; DE is to report on 10/14/17 @ 8:00 am.  No contact with Travis V., any co-defendants, known felons, or drug dealers.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the cost; written notice provided to defendant.
Defendant's Community Service Letters - filed by Attorney Rose
Sentencing hearing on October 4, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Court has reviewed and approves Agent Nolan's request for additional time to complete PSI so sentencing may be rescheduled.
Email correspondence received from Agent Nolan requesting additional time to complete PSI.

State appears by Special Prosecutor Thaddeus McGuire along with law studen, Bailing. Defendant, Justin J. Czerwionka, appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.  Clerk: PT
Upon hearing arguments court grants State's motion to revoke the deferred prosecution agreement.  DE is adjudged guilty and PSI is ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Filed by Atty T Rose
From Atty T Rose - stating he has not been retained to represent the deft
Motion hearing on July 28, 2017 at 09:45 am.

Deputy District Attorney Angelina Gabriele appeared with Jessica Behling for the State. Attorney Terry William Rose appeared by phone. Clerk: PT
Atty Rose states he hasn't seen State's motion that was efiled and hasn't had contact with DE.  Hearing is adjourned to allow Atty Rose time to review the motion and locate the defendant.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 28, 2017 at 09:45 am.  (Copy of motion emailed to Atty Rose)

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Justin J. Czerwionka, appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Count 1- Deft pleads Guilty; judgment is withheld and parties enter into a Stipulated Hold Open Agreement.
Count 2 - Deft. pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Sentence is withheld; Deft. placed on probation for 3 years with conditions.   No Contact with Travis V. and DE is ordered to complete 100 hours of community service.  DE may expunge his record upon successful completion of probation and conditions.  DPA Hearing on 3/9/18 at 9:30 AM.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning and Voting Acknowledgement given.  Cash Bond Continues.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Justin J. Czerwionka, appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.  Clerk: PT
Atty Rose states DE previously missed court because his vehicle broke down on the highway.  Court vacates bench warrant and will not forfeit prior bond; however, bond is increased to a $500 Cash Bond with same conditions.  DE has until 5:00 PM to post bond.  Jury Status on 2/26/15 at 1:00 PM; Jury Trial 3/2/15 at 8:30 AM.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Attorney Terry William Rose appeared on behalf of defendant who does not appear.  Clerk: PT
Atty Rose has no explanation for DE's non appearance, but may have thought he didn't have to be here today.  Court authorizes a Bench Warrant with a $5000 Cash Bond, but will stay warrant until 1/6/15 at which time bond will then be forfeited.
